text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to show you

how I make my waffle French toast. It is so
easy to make. I absolutely love making it

for breakfast on weekends, especially if you
have people coming over because it looks like

you have really put a lot of effort into it
but you really didn't. It is just incredibly

simple and easy. The ingredients you'll need
are very few. What I've got here is some bread

- you can use any bread you want. I am using
my homemade honey oat bread because it's just

delicious - so I am using that. You need a
couple of eggs, some brown sugar, a small

little pinch of cinnamon, vanilla, and milk.
That's it! You'll also need some melted butter

and your waffle maker or your waffle iron.
I've got mine preheating so it is going to

be ready for us whenever we are ready to use
it. Alright, I've got a little baking dish

here and in it I am going to put my eggs.
I am going to give those a quick little whisk

and I am going to add in my milk. This is
pretty much my standard - you know, my standard,

what am I trying to say? Please help me - French
toast! I'm just, I'm going to make a smaller

batch of it. I'm not using three eggs and
the full amount of milk. I am going to use

my brown sugar and vanilla. I love brown sugar,
you could use regular granulated sugar in

your French toast if you want to, I have always
happened to use brown sugar so that is why

I use that. And we also need a small splash
of vanilla. This is like the flavoring of

things. Now, what you can do is you can really
use any kind of bread that you want with this.

Traditionally, you use an eggy bread to make
French toast like a challah bread or brioche.

I've got my honey oat bread that you guys
have seen here before and it is just so good

because it's sweet yet slightly salty. It's
just - it's perfect. And it absorbs this just

beautifully and its been sitting on the - it's
a couple of days old. So, it's a little stale

which makes for great French toast. All I
am going to do is I am going to take a couple

of slices at a time and I am going to just
dunk them in there and let them sit there

for a few minutes until - not a few minutes,
a few seconds on each side. You really want

that custard to be soaked up by the bread.
So I would say about fifteen seconds on each

side. You let it sit and kind of soak it up.
Now, I am going to do two slices at a time

because my waffle maker - the little squares
are a bit on the smaller side. I just make

sure I brush it with some melted butter and
this is a heat proof spatula so it's not going

to melt. Just make sure you brush it so it
gives you flavor and it also prevents it from

sticking, which is always good. But for anything
we just want flavor, right? I'm being greedy

here! Shocking, I know. Alright I'm going
to move this closer to me. I just put it down

like so. You can see my slices are a bit bigger,
but that's okay. I'm going to close this up

and I am going to let that cook until the
light goes green. In the meantime, I am going

to soak up the rest of my bread. Can I fit
this in here? Yes I can! Just taking my last

batch - oh look at that. They are amazing.
They small amazing. Essentially what you made

is French toast but you cooked it in the waffle
iron. All I need right now is some maple syrup

and I would be in heaven, but I don't have
any maple syrup right now so this is going

to have to do. I don't have it near me but
I'm excited. It's going to be hot. Also, what

you can do with the rest of them if you don't
plan on eating them all in one sitting - like

tonight it's just my husband and I and we're
not going to eat all six of them or five over

there. I am going to - How many are there?
There's five in total, I can't even count.

I am going to just freeze them and then when
I want them I just take them out and pop them

in the toaster or you can even put them in
a hot oven. Either way, you get them thawed

and have homemade, you know, waffle French
toast whenever you want it. So good! It gets

like crispy so it's really delicious and it's
not as soft but it's just traditional flavors

of French toast but it's got a little more
texture to it and a bit more flare. Laurainthekitchen.com

will have the recipe written for you. Let
me know what else you want to see in the waffle

maker because there's so many different things
we could do with it and I am going to show

you other things you can do using it but if
there's anything you want to see in particular

let me know down below. I hope you've enjoyed
spending time with me and I will see you next
time. Bye!
